linefit

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • linefit.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains some functionality related to other LineFit classes that either are used in multiple classes or potentially could be.
    Since:
    0.99.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

      Creates a menu item, adds the keystroke shortcut to it, adds it to the menu, and finally adds the action listener to it.
      static void inlayGuiItem(javax.swing.SpringLayout springLayout, javax.swing.JPanel panelToInlayIn, java.awt.Component toInlay, boolean alignToLeftSide, java.awt.Component leftRightObjToAlignTo, int leftOffset, int rightOffset, int topOffset, int bottomOffset)
      Inlays the component in another GUI item, positioning it vertically based on that item and horizontally based on the passed item which can be the same as the item it is inlayed in.

    • Method Detail

      • createAndAddMenuItem

        public static void createAndAddMenuItem(javax.swing.JMenu menuToAddTo,
                                        java.lang.String itemText,
                                        java.awt.event.ActionListener itemActionListener,
                                        java.lang.String itemShortcut)
        Creates a menu item, adds the keystroke shortcut to it, adds it to the menu, and finally adds the action listener to it. If either the keystroke or action listener are null, then it will skip adding them.
        Parameters:
        menuToAddTo - The JMenu to add the menu item to
        itemText - The text that will appear on the menu item
        itemActionListener - The action listener that is called when the menu item is clicked
        itemShortcut - The keyboard shortcut to use for this menu item or null to have no shortcut. It will show up on the right side of the menu item in a different font.

      • inlayGuiItem

        public static void inlayGuiItem(javax.swing.SpringLayout springLayout,
                                javax.swing.JPanel panelToInlayIn,
                                java.awt.Component toInlay,
                                boolean alignToLeftSide,
                                java.awt.Component leftRightObjToAlignTo,
                                int leftOffset,
                                int rightOffset,
                                int topOffset,
                                int bottomOffset)
        Inlays the component in another GUI item, positioning it vertically based on that item and horizontally based on the passed item which can be the same as the item it is inlayed in.
        Parameters:
        springLayout - The SpringLayout that is being used to layout the component
        panelToInlayIn - The JPanel to inlay the component in
        toInlay - The Component to inlay
        alignToLeftSide - True if the component is aligned based on the left side of the passed object to align horizontally off of
        leftRightObjToAlignTo - The component to align horizontally to
        leftOffset - The number of pixels to offset the inlayed component's left side to the component that it is being horizontally aligned to
        rightOffset - The number of pixels to offset the inlayed component's right side to the component that it is being horizontally aligned to
        topOffset - The number of pixels to offset the inlayed component's top from the panel it is being inlayed in
        bottomOffset - The number of pixels to offset the inlayed component's bottom from the panel it is being inlayed in
